metadata.description: Design Principles Database for Reko V0 Design Learning App

gestalt_principles.name: Gestalt Principles
gestalt_principles.description: Visual perception principles that describe how humans naturally organize visual elements

principles.name: Proximity
principles.definition: Elements close together are perceived as a group
principles.definition_mn: Ойр байрлалтай элементүүд нэг бүлэг гэж хүлээн зөвшөөрөгддөг
dont: Mix unrelated items in close proximity

principles.name: Similarity
principles.definition: Elements with same shape, color, or size are perceived as related
principles.definition_mn: Ижил хэлбэр, өнгө, хэмжээтэй элементүүд холбоотой гэж үздэг
do: Use consistent styling for similar functions
dont: Make clickable and non-clickable elements look the same

principles.name: Closure
principles.definition_mn: Тархи дутуу дүрсийг бүтэн болгож хардаг
dont: Make shapes too fragmented to recognize

principles.name: Continuity
principles.definition: The eye follows lines, curves, and paths naturally

principles.name: Figure/Ground
principles.definition: The brain separates figures from background
dont: Make figure and ground equally prominent

principles.name: Common Region
principles.definition: Elements within a boundary are perceived as a group
principles.definition_mn: Нэг хүрээнд байгаа элементүүд бүлэг болдог

principles.name: Common Fate
principles.definition: Elements moving in same direction are perceived as related
principles.definition_mn: Ижил чиглэлд хөдөлж буй элементүүд холбоотой

principles.name: Symmetry & Order
principles.definition: Symmetrical elements appear unified and stable
principles.definition_mn: Тэгш хэмтэй элементүүд нэгдмэл, тогтвортой харагддаг

principles.name: Prägnanz / Simplicity
principles.definition: The brain interprets ambiguous shapes as simple as possible
principles.definition_mn: Тархи хамгийн энгийн хэлбэрээр ойлгохыг эрмэлздэг

principles.name: Focal Point
principles.definition: Different or contrasting elements attract attention

color_theory.name: Color Theory
color_theory.description: Comprehensive understanding of color relationships and applications

primary.property: Cannot be created by mixing other colors

hue.name: Hue
hue.definition: The pure form of a color, its position on the color wheel

saturation.name: Saturation
saturation.definition: The intensity or purity of a color

value.name: Value / Brightness / Lightness
value.definition: How light or dark a color is

chroma.name: Chroma
chroma.definition: The purity of a color relative to gray

warm.visual_effect: Advance toward viewer, make spaces feel smaller

cool.visual_effect: Recede from viewer, make spaces feel larger

relative_temperature.note: Color temperature is relative to surrounding colors
relative_temperature.example: Red-purple appears cooler next to red, warmer next to blue

color_harmonies.name: Complementary
color_harmonies.warning: Can be jarring if both colors used equally

color_harmonies.name: Analogous
color_harmonies.warning: May lack contrast for important elements

color_harmonies.name: Triadic
color_harmonies.warning: Can be overwhelming if all at full saturation

color_harmonies.name: Split-Complementary
color_harmonies.definition: Base color + 2 adjacent to its complement (150° & 210°)
color_harmonies.warning: Requires careful balance of all three

color_harmonies.name: Monochromatic
color_harmonies.definition: Tints, shades, and tones of one hue
color_harmonies.warning: May lack visual interest without contrast

color_harmonies.name: Achromatic
color_harmonies.definition: No hue - only black, white, grays

typography.name: Typography
typography.description: The art and technique of arranging type

font_categories.name: Serif
font_categories.characteristics: Small lines at end of strokes

principles: Contrast in style but harmony in mood

masters.name: Jan Tschichold
masters.principle: Asymmetry over symmetry, sans-serif for modernity

8_point_grid.description: All spacing and sizing in multiples of 8

kenya_hara_ma.principle: White space is not empty - it's full of possibility

balance_types.symmetrical: Equal weight on both sides - formal, stable

rule_of_thirds.description: Divide into 3x3 grid, place focal points at intersections

gutenberg.description: Primary optical area top-left, terminal area bottom-right

principles.name: Unity
principles.description: All elements feel like they belong together

principles.name: Movement
principles.description: Guiding the eye through the design

three_levels.design_goal: Work well, feel good to use

three_levels.example: Products that become part of identity

affordance.definition: Visual cues suggesting how to use something

signifiers.definition: Signals indicating where action should occur

mappings.example: Stove dial position matching burner position

conceptual_model.definition: User's understanding of how something works

focus_states.contrast: Must be distinguishable from unfocused state

core_principles.name: Efficiency
core_principles.description: Allow users to accomplish tasks quickly

core_principles.name: Forgiveness
core_principles.application: Undo, confirmation dialogs, clear error messages

core_principles.name: Learnability
core_principles.description: Easy to learn for new users

cognitive_load.definition: Mental effort required to use interface

hicks_law.definition: Time to decide increases with number of choices
hicks_law.application: Limit options, categorize choices, highlight recommended

fitts_law.definition: Time to reach target depends on distance and size
fitts_law.application: Make important buttons large and accessible

millers_law.definition: Average person can hold 7±2 items in working memory
millers_law.application: Chunk content, limit nav items, use progressive disclosure

books.title: The Design of Everyday Things
books.author: Don Norman

frameworks.gulf_of_evaluation: Gap between action result and understanding

books.quote: Design is really an act of communication

books.title: Designing Design
books.author: Kenya Hara
books.philosophy: Design is not about solving but about discovering
books.quote: Design begins from finding a problem

books.title: White
books.author: Kenya Hara
books.quote: White is not a color but a way of perceiving

books.title: The Vignelli Canon
books.author: Massimo Vignelli
books.famous_rule: Use only 4-5 typefaces: Garamond, Bodoni, Century, Helvetica, Futura
books.quote: If you can design one thing, you can design everything

books.title: Grid Systems in Graphic Design
books.author: Josef Müller-Brockmann
books.quote: The grid is an aid, not a guarantee

books.title: Thinking with Type
books.author: Ellen Lupton
books.quote: Typography is what language looks like

books.title: Things I Have Learned in My Life So Far
books.author: Stefan Sagmeister
maxims: Trying to look good limits my life
Keeping a diary supports personal development

ten_principles.principle: Good design makes a product useful
Good design makes a product understandable
Good design is thorough down to the last detail
Good design is as little design as possible

books.title: Thoughts on Design
books.author: Paul Rand
books.quote: Don't try to be original, try to be good

books.title: The New Typography
books.author: Jan Tschichold
books.later_evolution: Returned to classicism, Penguin Books redesign

books.title: Interaction of Color
books.author: Josef Albers
books.central_thesis: Color is the most relative medium in art
key_concepts: Same color appears different based on surroundings

challenges: Growth teams taking over design systems

ui_ux.description: AI visual language with gradients, sparkles
ui_ux.warning: Avoid adding AI for hype only

reko_philosophy.name: Reko's Design Philosophy
reko_philosophy.description: Personal design principles developed through 15 years of experience

core_philosophy.ultimate_goal: Create designs that inspire human action and influence philosophy
core_philosophy.approach: Research-heavy process - spend most time studying before executing

primary_characteristics.name: Dynamic Tension
primary_characteristics.description: Prefer dynamic tension over perfect balance
primary_characteristics.effect: Creates energy and interest without chaos

primary_characteristics.name: Unified Element Shapes
primary_characteristics.description: Elements should share cohesive shape language

primary_characteristics.name: Soft Color Transitions
primary_characteristics.description: No hard color boundaries, smooth gradients

primary_characteristics.name: Minimal with Deep Emotion
primary_characteristics.description: Reduce to essentials but maintain emotional resonance

primary_characteristics.name: Interesting Elements
primary_characteristics.description: Avoid boring or melancholic - include engaging details
primary_characteristics.effect: Prevents designs from feeling empty or lifeless

eastern.application: Meaningful negative space as active element
Highlight rather than hide - celebrate the journey

emotional_design.application: Design for visceral, behavioral, and reflective responses

trend_approach.goal: Create hybrid styles that transcend current movements

color_preferences.style: Dark themes with deep, rich tones

process: Research and study references extensively (majority of time)
Create dynamic tension through intentional imbalance
checklist: Does it have dynamic tension (not static balance)?
Are elements unified but not boring?
Is there something interesting to discover?
Would it inspire action or thought?

learning_system.name: Learning & Evolution System
learning_system.description: System for collecting user design data and continuously improving emotional intelligence

design_sessions.description: Each design session captures user decisions

emotional_patterns.description: Track which design choices evoke which emotions

preference_evolution.description: Track how user preferences change over time

emotion_intelligence.description: Build deeper understanding of emotional design

principle_effectiveness.description: Track which principles work best in which contexts

examples: Try adding more whitespace for calmness

user_data_storage.name: User Design Data Storage
user_data_storage.description: Structure for storing and analyzing user-generated design data

aggregations.daily: Session counts, popular emotions, active principles
aggregations.weekly: Pattern discoveries, user growth, trend shifts
aggregations.monthly: Database evolution, major insights, system improvements

privacy.anonymization: User data anonymized for pattern analysis

emotion_design_map.name: Emotion-Design Intelligence Map
emotion_design_map.name_mn: Сэтгэл хөдлөл-Дизайн оюун ухааны газрын зураг
emotion_design_map.description: Living map of emotion-to-design-element correlations that grows with user data
learning_notes: Confidence increases with more user data
Mappings become more nuanced over time

auto_update_system.name: Auto-Update & Data Fetching System
auto_update_system.name_mn: Автомат шинэчлэл ба дата татах систем
auto_update_system.description: Automatically fetches and integrates new design-related information

live_trends.name: Live Trend Tracker
live_trends.description: Real-time tracking of emerging design trends

detection_methods.keyword_frequency: Track design term usage over time

fetch_log.name: Data Fetch Log
fetch_log.description: Log of all automated data fetches
